Constructor Detail

Board

public Board(int width,
             int height,
             int mines)
Constructs and initializes a new minesweeper board.

Parameters:
width - The width of the initial board, as an array size unit.
height - The height of the initial board, as an array size unit.
mines - Number of mines.
Method Detail

probe

public void probe(int x,
                  int y)
Probes a square. Reveals the value under it. May set the board state to solved or failed depends on what is under it or if all mines are clicked.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the square, as an array index.
y - The Y coordinate of the square, as an array index.

mark

public void mark(int x,
                 int y)
Marks a square mine.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the square, as an array index.
y - The Y coordinate of the square, as an array index.

unmark

public void unmark(int x,
                   int y)
Un-marks a flag.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the square, as an array index.
y - The Y coordinate of the square, as an array index.

getValue

public byte getValue(int x,
                     int y)
Gets the value of a square.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the square, as an array index.
y - The Y coordinate of the square, as an array index.
Returns:
A number represents the state of the square. The values are:
  • 0: Unknown.
  • 1: Not a mine.
  • 2: Marked as a mine.

getInformation

public byte getInformation(int x,
                           int y)
Gets the number value of a square, for displaying and solving.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the square, as an array index.
y - The Y coordinate of the square, as an array index.
Returns:
A number represents the value of the square. The values are:
  • 0 to 8: The number of mines around it.
  • 9: Marked as a mine. (when game over: exposed mine)
  • 10: Unmarked and un-probed.

display

public java.lang.String display()
Returns a string representation of the board state intended to displayed on a text interface or text output.

Returns:
The string of the board state.
